_schema.description: Comic style and aesthetic guidelines applied to all panels. Customize to match your desired art style.
notes: base_style is prepended to all prompts
important_restrictions are appended as warnings to avoid common issues

comic_aesthetic.base_style: Professional comic book panel illustration. High quality graphic novel art.
comic_aesthetic.art_style: Bold ink line art with vibrant colors. Dynamic composition with strong perspective. Sequential art style with clear visual storytelling. Expressive character poses and faces.
comic_aesthetic.setting_tone: Adventure narrative with rich world-building details.
comic_aesthetic.visual_quality: High detail, professional quality, publication-ready artwork.
important_restrictions: Maintain consistent character appearances across panels
Clear readable speech bubbles when dialogue is present

dialogue_rendering.instruction: Include speech bubbles with dialogue text clearly readable. Position bubbles to not obscure important visual elements. Use appropriate bubble shapes for different speech types (normal, shouting, whispering).

panel_guidelines.action_scenes: Dynamic angles, motion lines, dramatic lighting. Characters in mid-action poses.
panel_guidelines.dialogue_scenes: Clear character expressions, appropriate body language. Medium shots for conversation.
panel_guidelines.establishing_shots: Wide perspective showing environment and context. Set the scene before action.

aspect_ratio_usage.3:4: Standard panels in 2x2 grid layouts. Most common ratio.
aspect_ratio_usage.9:16: Tall/splash panels for dramatic full-page moments.
aspect_ratio_usage.16:9: Wide landscape panels for establishing shots and action sequences.
aspect_ratio_usage.1:1: Square panels - use sparingly, can create awkward layouts.
